column4: hi guys! my pretty fresh (1 day old) ubuntu installation just crashed and i dont find any error in /var/log/syslog ..
when it crashed did it restart or shutdown totally?
that's bad :/ not sure where the logs are sorry
have you checked all those logs? sort by date and check ones that have been written to from the time of the crash onwards
check messages, it requires root p/w though
how are you trying to edit it? do `sedit /etc/fstab` to edit as root
if it's deprecated my bad. I'm just throwing ideas at you
what's the name of the file you're viewing? /var/log/messages.log , yes?
this is mysterious. I dunno where else to check if it's not in /var/log
how long before you noticed it crashed and it shutdown? Did it crash & shutdown immediatly?
if it shutdown instantly, maybe it was a hardware fault. i'm just guessing though
genii-around : when has X ever crashed and just flat-out shutdown the computer? usually X restarts or it throws you into shell
I'm not 100% but it looks like just stuff to do with your network card. gnome-keyring manages keys for networks, ecore seems network-related since it has DNS in it's name.
doubt that network stuff crashed your computer. Particularly if it's been outputting these errors before and after the crash
if this happened only once, I'd just forget about it. also, i'd hate for this to be a hardware fault :/

seems like i cant do much anyways as logfiles are empty.. ofc i dont feel very confident about a crash without log entries on 2nd day of use (makes me guess it could be a HW / driver problem too :-( )
keep your receipts and warranty docs
i will thanks. if problems occur again i will probably try another distro first or to update some drivers .. it worked pretty well and out of the box yet ..
genii-around: thanks for your help and time, have a nice day bb
